summary:
Welcome to my LinkedIn profile!   I have over 30 years of in-depth interpersonal and organizational mindfulness experience: this includes 15 years as a Buddhist monk, attending many group silent retreats, as well as many retreats alone of up to 3 months. 

I work with talented, creative, quick-thinking executives and business leaders that want to grow and get results for themselves and their employees. For example, I have led a 10-day interpersonal mindfulness retreat with up to 50 people and have safely taken many people on a life-changing journey to have clarity, find meaning and purpose in their lives and to recognise peace.

I have worked with executives and staff and I enjoyed working with various organisations, like:
➢ One of the top-healthiest companies in the Netherlands.
➢ The biggest startup ecosystem in Europe.
➢ Senior healthcare executives who lead very large, diverse and ethically challenging environments.
➢ Peer and agile team coaches in the automotive industry, to develop their ability to listen, be  with uncertainty and collaborate.
➢ Developed the feedback skills of a large cybersecurity team's for international fashion brand.
➢ Developed and facilitated the first year-long mindfulness for educators program at Eton College.

Some of the skills and specialities that I developed in my career are:
Executive Coaching | Leadership Development | Agile Mindset Coaching | Organizational Development | Change Leadership | Cultural Transformation | Employee Engagement | Workshop Training and Facilitation.

I have made dramatic changes in my own life and understand the emotional roller coaster this can cause.  I developed the PlayfulMonk approach from dealing with complex situations, it develops presence and the ability to stay connected to yourself and others. Because of this, I live by these three standards:
𝗘𝗫𝗣𝗟𝗢𝗥𝗘:  What is blocking you from optimum performance?
𝗣𝗟𝗔𝗬: Learn to be adaptive and relaxed in the way you deal with complex situations.
𝗟𝗢𝗩𝗘:   Love what you do and yourself. Empower the people around you to do the same.

To learn more about me, please feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or reach out via:

profile_positions.description:
I bring mindfulness based interventions to organization with the unique program called ‘The Playful Monk program.’ This is based on the culmination of over 30 years practice of ancient techniques integrated with a wide range of self-developments processes and informed by science. 

➢ I'm an expert in applying mindfulness interpersonally to support behavioural changes that are catalysts for transformation and well-being of an organisation.
➢ Whether you meet me in a workshop, retreat or personally, my approach is to respond to the situation as it unfolds. 
➢ I facilitate a safe space enabling you to recognize your own wisdom, through co-exploration, playfulness, and love. 
➢ I'm interested in finding ways of being authentic whilst recognizing that everything is already okay.

As a mindfulness based executive coach I support executives to be less judgemental, relate better to their staff and piers, make better choices, deal with VUCA (volatility, uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity) and create structures that support well-being for their organizations. 

By exploring the dynamics of the way we relate to each other, we can start to recognize the limitations we impose on ourselves and access more:
➢ Energy
➢ Abundance
➢ Peace 
➢ Wisdom
profile_positions.title: Coaching Supervisor, Mindfulness based executive coach, Agile mindset coach, Speaker, Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
➢ Develop your coaching through a reflective learning partnership.
➢ Whether you are a life, executive, agile coach, HR professional or people specialist coaching others this is a continuously developing skill.
➢ Having a safe and confidential space to reflect on your clients or teams which is not connected to your workspace allows you to get perspective on the different relationship in coaching.
➢ It can help you develop both professionally and personally, help you stay focused and non-judgemental, resolve ethical issues and deal with boundary management.
➢ I am EMCC Global coach/mentor supervisor (ESIA) and they recommend 1 hour of supervision per 35 hours of practice, ensuring a minimum of 4 hours per year, evenly distributed if possible.
